ch.iserver.ace.net.protocol
Class AbstractConnection

java.lang.Object
  ch.iserver.ace.net.protocol.AbstractConnection
Direct Known Subclasses:
MainConnection, ParticipantConnectionImpl, SessionConnectionImpl
public abstract class AbstractConnection
extends Object

AbstractConnection contains all common functionality for a connection. A connection is basically a wrapper around a org.beepcore.beep.core.Channel.

LOG

protected org.apache.log4j.Logger LOG

STATE_INITIALIZED

public static final int STATE_INITIALIZED
State initialized. The connection is created but the channel not yet started.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATE_ACTIVE

public static final int STATE_ACTIVE
State active. The connection is initialized and the channel established

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATE_DIRTY

public static final int STATE_DIRTY
State dirty. A failure has occured while sending data.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATE_ABORTED

public static final int STATE_ABORTED
State aborted. Recovery for connection failed.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATE_CLOSED

public static final int STATE_CLOSED
State closed. Channel closed and resources released.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Method Detail

send

public void send(byte[] message,
                 Object data,
                 ReplyListener listener)
          throws ProtocolException
Sends a message to the peer with whom this connection is established.

Parameters:
message - the message to be sent
data - additional in-process data for this channel, not sent to peer
listener - the listener for responses sent by the peer
Throws:
ProtocolException - thrown if an error occurs

cleanup

public abstract void cleanup()
Cleans up this connection and frees any resources.

recover

public abstract void recover()
                      throws RecoveryException
Recovers this connection from a dirty state (e.g. exception thrown when sending data). After calling this method the transmission of the data is tried again.

Throws:
RecoveryException - if the recovery fails
